questions.question: what library of react do we use for routing and what components

answer_candidates.narration: The react-router library and from there the components Router and Route
React doesnt provide a way for routing but an interface to interact with routing from a server
The react-router library but no components are of any use

questions.question: What means to decouple route declarations in React

answer_candidates.narration: To declare routes in different components as opposed to only in one.
To have routes that are in pairs divided in two parts

questions.question: what does +id do?
questions.answer: cast id to a number value

answer_candidates.narration: equivalent to ++id it adad 1 to the value id and then stores it on id

questions.question: when defining path= path/(:desc), how is desc bieng defined there
questions.answer: as an optional value that might be defined in the url

questions.question: what is the diference between a url parameter and a query parameter
questions.answer: /url_parameter and /?query)parameter=value, the first is a url_parameter with the value url_parameter and the second is a query parameter with the value value

questions.question: What is lazy routing
questions.answer: Avoid loading all routes by loading them gradually as the user interact with the components.
